On 3/6/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> So it's=
 your choice: which do you value more? The API as it is now, or
> writing g=
ood tests? If you value the first one more, you'll have to
> settle for lon=
ger, more brittle, more expensive tests. That's a judgment
> only your team=
 can make.


I think Kamal made it clear that changing the API was not an o=
ption, so he's
definitely looking for an option to test an API that he has =
no control
over.  Sad, but fairly common in my opinion.

It's already been =
done, but I'll repeat it:  Michael Feather's book "Testing
legacy code" con=
tains some good advice for these kinds of situations

I envy people who hav=
e write access to 100% of the code they need to test,
they don't know how e=
asy they have it :-)

--
C=E9dric
